com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.objects.data_analytics.AnalyticThreadJobBean

    • Uses of AnalyticThreadJobBean in com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interfaces.data_analytics

      Methods in com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interfaces.data_analytics that return types with arguments of type AnalyticThreadJobBean 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Optional<AnalyticThreadJobBean> IAnalyticsContext.getJob()
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns the specified job
      Methods in com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interfaces.data_analytics with parameters of type AnalyticThreadJobBean 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<Boolean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.checkAnalyticJobProgress(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_check, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Checks the job's progress: return true if complete, false if still going (optionally, "in progress" information can be returned via the management side-channel)
      boolean IAnalyticsContext.checkForListeners(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job)
      This checks whether another analytic job has requested a stream of objects - if so then sendObjectToStreamingPipeline can be used to forward them
      fj.data.Validation<BasicMessageBean,com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> IAnalyticsContext.emitObject(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job, fj.data.Either<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode,Map<String,Object>> object, Optional<AnnotationBean> annotations)
      (Analytic Module only) For output modules for the particular technology to output objects reasonably efficient, if an output service is not available Also supports: a) writing objects to sub-buckets (use the sub-bucket full_name - the system will fill the rest in) b) external buckets (again - only the full name is required, the system will authorize and fill in)
      CompletableFuture<?> IAnalyticsContext.flushBatchOutput(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job)
      (Analytic Module only) Flushes any pending batch output, eg before a process exits
      List<String> IAnalyticsContext.getInputPaths(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job, AnalyticThreadJobBean.AnalyticThreadJobInputBean job_input)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) For jobs that read from file (either temporary or persistent), this provides a set of file paths from which to read
      List<String> IAnalyticsContext.getInputTopics(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job, AnalyticThreadJobBean.AnalyticThreadJobInputBean job_input)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) For jobs that read from real-time queues, this provides a set of topics from which to read (Will also subscribe to the bucket so that the related bucket will start streaming if it is not already)
      Optional<scala.Tuple2<String,Optional<String>>> IAnalyticsContext.getOutputPath(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Gets the path to which this (possibly) intermediate job should write data For non-temporary jobs that write to file, or permanent jobs with no temporal settings - a single string is returned, which is the path to which to write For bucket output with temporal settings, 2 strings are returned - the first is the base directory, the second is a DateFormat string that is the time-based sub-directory to which files should be written (If the bucket has no file output then no strings are returned) Note that for any specific technology it is possible to request an outputter of the right format via getServiceOutput instead - if it exists then it will likely contain an efficient pre-built module Or just write your own outputter calling emitOutput
      Optional<String> IAnalyticsContext.getOutputTopic(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Gets the topic to which this (possibly) intermediate job should stream real-time data This is for passing the topic into an external library - alternatively sendObjectToStreamingPipeline can be called
      <T extends IAnalyticsAccessContext<?>>
      Optional<T>      		 IAnalyticsContext.getServiceInput(Class<T> clazz, Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job, AnalyticThreadJobBean.AnalyticThreadJobInputBean job_input)
      For data services, you can either request an underlying technology (eg InputFormat for Hadoop/RichSpout for Storm/etc), or an ICrudService (of JsonNode) as a backup Can't call getServiceInput/Output after getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries
      <T extends IAnalyticsAccessContext<?>>
      Optional<T>      		 IAnalyticsContext.getServiceOutput(Class<T> clazz, Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job, String data_service)
      Requests a technology-specific output for the given data service (eg OutputFormat for Hadoop/Bolt for Storm/etc), or an IDataWriteService (of JsonNode) as a backup Can't call getServiceInput/Output after getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.resumeAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_resume, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Responsible for re-activating the specified analytic job (which has previously been suspended) Normally suspend/resume will just call stop/start since most analytic platforms don't have explicit support for suspension/resumption
      fj.data.Validation<BasicMessageBean,com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> IAnalyticsContext.sendObjectToStreamingPipeline(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job, fj.data.Either<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode,Map<String,Object>> object, Optional<AnnotationBean> annotations)
      (Analytic Module only) If another component is requesting streaming access to the output (use checkForListeners to find out) then this utility function will output the objects Note emitObject automatically checks for this, so this only need be called if emitObject is not being used.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.startAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_start, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Responsible for actually starting the specified analytic job
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.startAnalyticJobTest(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_test, ProcessingTestSpecBean test_spec, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Similar to startAnalyticJob, but with the knowledge this is only a test.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.stopAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_stop, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Responsible for actually stopping the specified analytic job (eg if the job is deleted)
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.suspendAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_suspend, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Responsible for suspending the specified analytic job Normally suspend/resume will just call stop/start since most analytic platforms don't have explicit support for suspension/resumption
      Method parameters in com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interfaces.data_analytics with type arguments of type AnalyticThreadJobBean 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.canRunOnThisNode(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context)
      This function should check the local environment, decide whether the technology module can run on this node (eg is the external software installed? are the environment variables set up correctly etc) and return true/false as quickly as possibly.
      FutureUtils.ManagementFuture<Boolean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.checkAnalyticJobProgress(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_check, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Checks the job's progress: return true if complete, false if still going (optionally, "in progress" information can be returned via the management side-channel)
      CompletableFuture<Map<String,String>> IAnalyticsContext.getAnalyticsLibraries(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs)
      (AnalyticsTechnology only) For each library defined by the thread.module_names_or_ids/thread.analytic_name_or_id, returns a FileSystem path
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.onDeleteThread(DataBucketBean to_delete_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Notification that the bucket containing this analytic thread is being deleted.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.onNewThread(DataBucketBean new_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context, boolean enabled)
      Handles a new thread being created - Note this notification does not mean that the thread should be started, (EXCEPT optionally for stream jobs when the bucket is active) ie it can usually just be "stubbed out" (but can be used for any required administrative actions/updating internal state etc) (That is handled via the a set of calls to startAnalyticJob (and notified via onThreadExecute)) This method is called for each analytic technology that is part of a thread
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.onPeriodicPoll(DataBucketBean polled_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Periodic poll for statistics collection, health checks, etc.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.onPurge(DataBucketBean purged_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Notification that all data for a bucket associated with this thread is to be purged Note that the actual purging is performed by the framework, so this is in case the state needs to be updated etc.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.onTestThread(DataBucketBean test_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, ProcessingTestSpecBean test_spec, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Notifies this analytic thread that a job is about to start a test.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.onThreadComplete(DataBucketBean completed_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context)
      For batch type harvest technologies (eg file not streaming), this callback is called when a batch is complete.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.onThreadExecute(DataBucketBean new_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, Collection<AnalyticThreadTriggerBean.AnalyticThreadComplexTriggerBean> matching_triggers, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Invoked when an analytic bucket is triggered.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.onUpdatedThread(DataBucketBean old_analytic_bucket, DataBucketBean new_analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, boolean is_enabled, Optional<BucketDiffBean> diff, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Handles changes to an existing analytic thread - note this notification does not mean that the thread should be started, ie it can usually just be "stubbed out" (but can be used for any required administrative actions/updating internal state etc) (That is handled via the set of calls to startAnalyticJob (and notified via onThreadExecute)) This method is called for each analytic technology that is part of a thread If the thread is being suspended as part of the update, this callback has no responsibility for stopping anything, that will be handled by separate calls to suspendAnalyticJob (EXCEPT optionally for stream jobs when the bucket is active)
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.resumeAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_resume, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Responsible for re-activating the specified analytic job (which has previously been suspended) Normally suspend/resume will just call stop/start since most analytic platforms don't have explicit support for suspension/resumption
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.startAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_start, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Responsible for actually starting the specified analytic job
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.startAnalyticJobTest(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_test, ProcessingTestSpecBean test_spec, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Similar to startAnalyticJob, but with the knowledge this is only a test.
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.stopAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_stop, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Responsible for actually stopping the specified analytic job (eg if the job is deleted)
      default boolean IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.supportsMultiNode(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Whether this engine can be run in multi-node (defaults to false)
      CompletableFuture<BasicMessageBean> IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.suspendAnalyticJob(DataBucketBean analytic_bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs, AnalyticThreadJobBean job_to_suspend, IAnalyticsContext context)
      Responsible for suspending the specified analytic job Normally suspend/resume will just call stop/start since most analytic platforms don't have explicit support for suspension/resumption
